<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	AMENDED AND RESTATED MINING AGREEMENT
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	THIS AMENDED AND RESTATED AGREEMENT (herein called this &#147;
<U>
	Agreement
</U>
	&#148;) is made and effective as of November&nbsp;30, 2015, by
	and between ARCILLA MINING &amp; LAND CO., LLC, a limited liability company organized and existing under the laws of the state of Georgia and having an office at P.O. Box 1371, Milledgeville, Georgia 31061 (&#147;
<U>
	Contractor
</U>
	&#148;), and CARBO
	CERAMICS INC., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the state of Delaware and having an office at 575 North Dairy Ashford, Suite 300, Houston, Texas 77079 (&#147;
<U>
	Owner
</U>
	&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, Contractor and Owner entered into that certain Mining Agreement, dated as of January 1, 2003 (the &#147;
<U>
	2003 Mining
	Agreement
</U>
	&#148;), as amended by that certain Addendum to Mining Agreement between such parties, dated November 10, 2009 (the &#147;
<U>
	Addendum
</U>
	,&#148; and the 2003 Mining Agreement, as amended by the Addendum, being the &#147;
<U>
	Original
	Agreement
</U>
	&#148;), where Contractor agreed to:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	mine (either from lands owned or leased by Owner (the &#147;
<U>
	Owner&#146;s Lands
</U>
	&#148;)) or from lands owned or leased by Contractor as described on
<U>
	Exhibit B
</U>
	,
<U>
	Exhibit C
</U>
	,
<U>
	Exhibit D
</U>
	and
<U>
	Exhibit E
</U>
	hereto (collectively, the &#147;
<U>
	Contractors&#146; Lands
</U>
	&#148;); and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	deliver to Owner&#146;s Toomsboro and McIntyre manufacturing plants in Wilkinson County, Georgia (the &#147;
<U>
	Plant
</U>
	&#148;)a supply of kaolin, a naturally occurring mineral described in the Agreement, meeting the
	specifications set forth in
<U>
	Exhibit A
</U>
	hereto (the &#147;
<U>
	Product
</U>
	&#148;);
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, Contractor was mistakenly
	identified by the parties to both the 2003 Mining Agreement and the Addendum as Arcilla Mining &amp; Land Company, a Georgia corporation;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the parties agree and acknowledge that Arcilla Mining &amp; Land Company, LLC, the &#147;Contractor&#148; named herein, is the
	correct party to both the 2003 Mining Agreement and the Addendum, and hereby ratify and affirm that the 2003 Mining Agreement and the Addendum are legally binding agreements between the parties hereto as of the date hereof;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, Contractor is able and desires to mine and deliver the Product to Owner; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, Contractor and Owner desire to amend and restate the Original Agreement in its entirety as set forth herein;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage73"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein, the
	parties agree as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	TERM
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The term of this Agreement shall remain in effect until all of Owner&#146;s Lands and
	Contractor&#146;s Lands shall have been depleted;
<U>
	provided
</U>
	, that either Owner or Contractor may terminate this Agreement effective at any time after December 31, 2030, upon not less than twelve (12) month&#146;s prior written notice thereof
	to Contractor or Owner, respectively. Options to extend the Agreement will be only upon the mutual agreement of Owner and Contractor.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	CONTRACTOR&#146;S RESPONSIBILITIES
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Contractor shall be specifically responsible for the
	following (herein called the &#147;
<U>
	Work
</U>
	&#148;):
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. Obtaining and maintaining a valid mining permit from the State of Georgia and
	any other governmental body which requires Contractor to have a license or permit to mine and remove Product from the Subject Properties pursuant to this Agreement;
<U>
	provided
</U>
	, that (i) Contractor shall bear all costs of obtaining such permits
	(including costs relating to obtaining bonds for such permits) as to Contractor&#146;s Lands; and (ii) Owner shall bear all costs of obtaining such permits (including costs relating to obtaining bonds for such permits) as to Owner&#146;s Lands.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. Removing overburden from the Subject Properties in a manner so as to allow Owner unimpeded access to a minimum of
<B>
	[XXX]
</B>
	tons of
	Product at any given time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C. Maintaining roads to, from and across the Subject Properties in a manner suitable to mine and remove from
	the Subject Properties the Product described in this Contract.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	D. Reclaiming the Subject Properties in accordance with the permit(s)
	Contractor has obtained.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	E. Providing to Owner a site of location, size and character upon which to stockpile approximately
<B>
	[XXX]
</B>
	tons of the Product and maintaining such stockpile at all times during the term of this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	F. Mining sufficient quantities of the
	Product to fill orders made by Owner on an &#147;as needed&#148; basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	G. Delivering to the Plants the quantities of the Product ordered
	by Owner. If Owner requests delivery to any location other than the Plants, Owner shall bear all costs for transportation in excess of the cost to transport the Product to the Plant farthest away from such alternate location.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	PURCHASE COMMITMENT
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. From and after July 1, 2014, and subject to the next following sentence
	below, Owner shall be obligated to accept deliveries of conforming Product from Contractor totaling,
<B>
	[XXX]
</B>
	of its actual annual requirements of the Product during such year for the Plants&#146; total operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 2 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage74"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. Pursuant to this
<U>
	Section 3
</U>
	, if at any time Owner specifies to Contractor certain
	locations within the Owner&#146;s Lands that Owner wants to be mined to fulfill orders under this Agreement and during what time period(s), Contractor shall either (i) confirm to Owner that it will mine such locations; or (ii) decline to mine such
	locations, in which latter event Owner shall have the right to engage a third party to mine such locations during such time period(s) and Owner&#146;s minimum purchase requirements set forth in
<U>
	Section 3.A
</U>
	above shall be reduced by the number
	of tons of Product mined during such period by such third party.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C. In the event Contractor fails to deliver Product in a timely manner
	which has been ordered by Owner and Owner purchases such Product from another source or contracts with another contractor to mine and deliver such Product, Owner shall deduct the amount of such purchase or delivery from another source from the
	minimum purchase requirements set out in this
<U>
	Section 3
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	D. Notwithstanding the foregoing requirements in this
<U>
	Section 3
</U>
	,
	Owner will be allowed to source raw materials from third parties for the purposes of conducting manufacturing trials at its Plants and such purposes shall not violate the aforementioned commitments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	4.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	PRICE
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The price per ton for the Product mined and delivered by Contractor to the Plant shall
	be as set forth on
<U>
	Appendix A
</U>
	attached hereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. The amount shown for Haulage Charge in on
<U>
	Appendix A
</U>
	shall be increased
	or decreased monthly as provided on
<U>
	Appendix&nbsp;B
</U>
	attached hereto to account for the varying prices of diesel fuel.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. All
	charges shown on
<U>
	Appendix A
</U>
	shall be adjusted on
<B>
	[XXX]
</B>
	during the term hereof to reflect any changes in the Producer Price Index for kaolin and ball clay (product code 1455) (the &#147;
<U>
	PPI
</U>
	&#148;) that occurred during the prior
<B>
	[XXX]
</B>
	-month period. The adjustment shall be made as soon as the PPI for the applicable period is made available by the U.S. Department of Labor, Bureau of Labor Statistics or any other U.S. government organization that may have responsibility
	for publishing PPI data in the future. Contractor and Owner hereby recognize that such data is preliminary as initially published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics and agree to accept this preliminary data as final for purposes of calculating the
	adjustment to such charges. Notwithstanding the adjustment determined in accordance with this
<U>
	Section 4.B
</U>
	, (i) at no time shall such any such charges be less than the amount shown for each charge in
<U>
	Appendix A
</U>
	; and (ii) in no event
	will the aggregate amount per short wet ton determined in accordance with
<U>
	Appendix A
</U>
	: (x) decrease from the immediately preceding year&#146;s aggregate amount per short wet ton more than
<B>
	[XXX]
</B>
	; or (y) increase from the immediately
	preceding year&#146;s aggregate amount per short wet ton more than
<B>
	[XXX]
</B>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C. If the cost of insurance required to be carried by
	Contractor pursuant to
<U>
	Section 11
</U>
	below increases in any year by more than
<B>
	[XXX]
</B>
	over the cost of such insurance for the immediately preceding year, Contractor shall notify Owner in writing (the &#147;
<U>
	Notice of Premium
	Increase
</U>
	&#148;). For a period of thirty (30) days from the date of Notice of Premium Increase, Contractor and Owner shall negotiate in good faith to reach a mutually agreeable increase in the
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 3 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage75"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Price Per Ton to compensate Contractor for the increased cost of insurance applicable to this Agreement. If Owner and Contractor fail to reach a mutually agreeable increase in the Price Per Ton
	within such thirty (30) day period, this Agreement shall terminate one year from the date of the most recent Notice of Premium Increase.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	D. From and after the date of this Agreement, if:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Contractor enters into any agreement (each, a &#147;
<U>
	Third Party Agreement
</U>
	&#148;) with any other purchaser of product from Contractor that meets or exceeds the specifications for Product set forth herein (any
	product that meets or exceeds such specifications being called &#147;
<U>
	Conforming Product
</U>
	&#148;); and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the pricing then in effect for the Conforming Product purchased under a Third Party Agreement, as set forth therein, is lower than the pricing then in effect under this Agreement for the Product (after such pricing is
	adjusted (x) for differences in mining ratios as compared to the Conforming Product purchased by such third party; and (y) for the distance such Conforming Product is to be hauled as compared to the distance to the Plant);
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	then Contractor shall notify Owner of this fact within a reasonable period of time and this Agreement shall be deemed to be modified to provide Owner with
	such lower pricing, effective as of the first delivery date of Product to the applicable purchaser under the Third Party Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	E.
	From and after the date of this Agreement, should Owner become aware of a Third Party Supplier (as defined in
<U>
	Section 4.F
</U>
	immediately below) providing pricing for Conforming Product that is lower than the pricing provided for Product herein,
	Contractor shall modify the pricing herein to match such lower price.
<U>
	Notwithstanding the foregoing
</U>
	, (x) any such pricing for Conforming Product shall be adjusted for differences in mining ratios as compared to the Product in order to
	determine whether such pricing for the Conforming Product is lower than that of the Product; and (y) in no event shall greater than
<B>
	[XXX]
</B>
	of Owner&#146;s actual annual requirements of the Product be purchased from all Third Party Suppliers in
	the aggregate in any calendar year. In the event Contractor does not modify its pricing as and if required in this
<U>
	Section 4.E
</U>
	, Owner shall have the right to purchase quantities of Conforming Product from such Third Party Supplier and, to the
	extent Conforming Product is purchased therefrom, reduce, accordingly, Owner&#146;s required minimum purchases of Product from Contractor specified in
<U>
	Section 3.A
</U>
	above.&nbsp;The immediately foregoing sentence shall in no event relieve
	Contractor of its supply requirements contained herein.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	F. For a party to be deemed a &#147;
<U>
	Third Party Supplier
</U>
	&#148; hereunder,
	it or the Conforming Product shall, as applicable, in all material respects meet the following criteria:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Such party shall be bonded by the States of Georgia or Alabama, if applicable;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Such party shall substantially adhere to insurance requirements and shall provide Conforming Product that meets the quality specifications for Product set forth in this Agreement on
<U>
	Exhibit A
</U>
	;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 4 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage76"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Such party shall have obtained and shall maintain mining permits from the applicable state for mine locations and be subject to an obligation to perform complete reclamation thereof;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Such party shall be in compliance with all pertinent State and Federal Regulations; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(v)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Such party shall have an MSHA safety rating substantially equal to that of Contractor.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	5.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	MINING AND DELIVERY
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. Owner shall advise Contractor on or before October 1 of each year of
	the tonnage of the Product it projects to require during the next calendar year. Such projections should be estimates only and Owner shall not be committed to accept deliveries of such amounts. Owner shall use reasonable efforts to advise Contractor
	promptly in the event of any change in its annual requirements projections for any year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. Owner and Contractor shall communicate
	regularly, and Contractor shall ensure the availability of Product for delivery hereunder on an &#147;as needed&#148; basis. Owner shall use its best efforts (to the extent feasible) to space evenly its actual orders of the Product, and Contractor
	shall be obligated to fill such orders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C. Owner and Contractor shall jointly prepare and agree on a plan for the efficient mining of
	Product from the Owner&#146;s Lands and the Contractor&#146;s Lands (the &#147;
<U>
	Mining Plan
</U>
	&#148;). In the event of any dispute regarding the Mining Plan, Owner shall make the final determination as to how properties will be mined.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	D. Risk of loss and title for all Product mined from the Contractor&#146;s Lands shall pass to Owner upon delivery to one of the Plants.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	6.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	PAYMENT
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Invoices for Product mined and delivered hereunder shall be sent to Owner on a monthly
	basis. Payment for the Product mined and delivered hereunder shall be net thirty (30) days from date of invoice.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	7.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	ASCERTAINMENT OF WEIGHT
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The weight of the Product delivered shall be determined by weighing on
	state-certified scales located at Owner&#146;s manufacturing facility in Wilkinson County, Georgia. Invoices shall include a copy of the weight-ticket covering the Product being invoiced.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	8.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	WARRANTY
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Contractor warrants that the kaolin material when delivered to the Plant will conform
	to all chemical and physical properties for the Product listed in
<U>
	Exhibit A
</U>
	hereto. Contractor warrants that the Product delivered hereunder shall be free of contaminants and other foreign
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 5 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage77"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	substances rendering the Product unsuitable for the economic use of Owner. In the event that kaolin material delivered to Owner does not conform to all chemical and physical properties listed in
<U>
	Exhibit A
</U>
	hereto, or is contaminated with foreign substances, all such non-conforming kaolin material shall be removed by Contractor and there shall be no invoice issued by Contractor for the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-conforming
</FONT>
	kaolin material.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	9.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	OWNER&#146;S LANDS; RESERVED ORE &amp; CONTRACTOR&#146;S REPRESENTATION OF TITLE AND INDUCEMENTS TO OWNER
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. Contractor&#146;s Lands.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Contractor hereby represents that it holds title to or the right to mine crude Product located on the Contractor&#146;s Lands, which will be reserved by Contractor for sale to Owner.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Contractor covenants that it has a good and marketable title, in fee simple or leasehold estate, to the Contractor&#146;s Lands, that there are no liens, mortgages or encumbrances against the same, and Contractor
	warrants the title to all Product which Owner, its successors and assigns may remove or receive from the Contractor&#146;s Lands for processing and/or sale as against the lawful claims of all persons whomsoever. Contractor shall provide to Owner
	evidence, such as a current title report or title insurance commitment, of (i) Contractor&#146;s good and marketable title to the portions of the Contractor&#146;s Lands which Contractor owns in fee simple and (ii) Contractor&#146;s lessor&#146;s
	good and marketable title to the portions of the Contractor&#146;s Lands as to which Contractor holds a leasehold estate. Also, Contractor shall provide to Owner a copy of the lease agreement covering those portions of the Contractor&#146;s Lands as
	to which Contractor holds a leasehold estate and letter signed by the lessor in the form of
<U>
	Exhibit F
</U>
	attached hereto. Contractor further covenants that hereafter Contractor will not create nor permit the existence of any liens or
	encumbrances against the minerals or surface which will in any way adversely affect the rights of Owner hereunder. Upon any default of Contractor with respect to the covenants and warranties herein contained, it is agreed that Owner shall have the
	privilege of paying-off, discharging and satisfying any such lien or encumbrance and that the amount of any such payment or payments made by Owner for such purposes, together with interest thereon at the prime rate (as published in the Wall Street
	Journal on the date of default declaration) plus two (2) per cent per year, may be deducted by Owner from the payments herein provided to be paid to Contractor.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Contractor further warrants that (a) Contractor has a good and lawful right, and full power to convey the Product on the Contractor&#146;s Lands and
	to authorize entry for the purposes(s) herein set forth, that the same are free from all encumbrances; (b) the Contractor&#146;s Lands connect to adjacent public roads and all present exits and entrances to the Contractor&#146;s Lands via adjacent
	public roads are without restriction; (c) Contractor is not a party to any litigation affecting the Contractor&#146;s Lands, the Product thereon, or Contractor&#146;s rights to sell the Product on said Contractor&#146;s Lands or any interest therein
	and Contractor knows of no litigation or
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 6 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage78"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	threatened litigation affecting the said Product and/or the Contractor&#146;s Lands; (d) Contractor has no knowledge or information of any facts or circumstances that would adversely affect the
	use of the Contractor&#146;s Lands for mining operations that are not set forth herein; and (e) that Contractor has not committed, except as otherwise set forth herein, nor will Contractor in the future commit, any act or acts which will encumber or
	cause a lien to be placed against said Product and/or the Contractor&#146;s Lands.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. Owner&#146;s Lands. Owner holds title
	to or the right to mine crude Product located on the Owner&#146;s Lands, which shall be mined by Contractor pursuant to the terms of this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C. Owner&#146;s Lands and Contractor&#146;s Lands are herein sometimes collectively called the &#147;
<U>
	Subject Properties
</U>
	&#148; or a
	&#147;
<U>
	Property
</U>
	&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	10.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	INDEMNIFICATION
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To the fullest extent permitted by law, Contractor shall indemnify and hold
	harmless Owner, and agents and employees of Owner from and against claims, damages, losses and expenses, including but not limited to attorneys&#146; fees, arising out of or resulting from performance of the Work, provided that such claim, damage,
	loss or expense is attributable to bodily injury, sickness, disease or death, or to injury to or destruction of tangible property (other than the Work itself) including loss of use resulting therefrom, but only to the extent caused in whole or in
	part by negligent acts or omissions or breach of this Agreement by Contractor or anyone directly or indirectly employed by Contractor or anyone for whose acts Contractor may be liable, regardless of whether or not such claim, damage, loss or expense
	is caused in part by the negligence of a party indemnified hereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	11.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	INSURANCE
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Contractor shall purchase from and maintain in a company or companies lawfully
	authorized to do business in the jurisdiction in which the Subject Properties are located such insurance as will protect Contractor and Owner from claims set forth below which may arise out of or result from Contractor&#146;s operations under this
	Agreement and for which Contractor may be legally liable, whether such operations be by Contractor or by a subcontractor or by anyone directly or indirectly employed by any of them, or by anyone for whose acts any of them may be liable:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. claims under workers&#146; or workmen&#146;s compensation, disability benefits and other similar employee benefit acts which are applicable
	to the Work to be performed;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. claims for damages because of bodily injury, occupational sickness or disease, or death of
	Contractor&#146;s employees;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C. claims for damages because of bodily injury, sickness or disease, or death of any person other than
	Contractor&#146;s employees;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 7 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage79"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	D. claims for damages insured by usual personal injury liability coverage which are sustained (1)
	by a person as a result of an offense directly or indirectly related to employment of such person by Contractor, or (2) by another person;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	E. claims for damages because of injury to or destruction of tangible property, including loss of use resulting therefrom;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	F. claims for damages because of bodily injury, death of a person or property damage arising out of ownership, maintenance or use of a motor
	vehicle; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	G. claims involving contractual liability insurance applicable to Contractor&#146;s obligations under
<U>
	Section 10
</U>
	above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The insurance required by this Section shall be written for not less than limits of liability specified herein or required by law,
	whichever coverage is greater. Coverages shall be written on an occurrence basis and shall be maintained without interruption from date of commencement of the Work until date of termination of this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Certificates of Insurance acceptable to Owner shall be filed with Owner prior to commencement of the Work. These Certificates and the
	insurance policies required by this
<U>
	Section 11
</U>
	shall contain a provision that coverages afforded under the policies will not be canceled or allowed to expire until at least 30 days&#146; prior written notice has been given to Owner.
	Contractor shall provide evidence of continued insurance on the anniversary date of each policy of insurance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Contractor shall maintain
	worker&#146;s compensation in at least the minimum amount stipulated under the Georgia worker&#146;s compensation statutes, including Employers Liability with a limit of at least:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Contractor shall maintain Commercial General Liability, written on an occurrence basis, including
	Contractor&#146;s Liability; Independent Contractors Liability; Contractual Liability; Completed Operations and Products Liability; Personal Injury Coverage and broad form Property Damage extended to apply to completed operations; and no property
	damage liability exclusions pertaining to loss by explosion, collapse or underground damage.
</P>

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_39"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="68%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="90%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="4%">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="68%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

	Combined Single Limit
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</B>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">

	[XXX
</B>

<B>
	]&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Contractor shall not commence Work at the Subject Properties under this Agreement until it has obtained all
	required insurance and until such insurance has been approved by Owner. Approval of the insurance by Owner shall not relieve or decrease the liability of Contractor hereunder. Certificates of Insurance shall be filed with Contractor prior to
	commencing Work.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The required insurance shall be written by a Company licensed to do business in the state in which the Subject
	Properties are located, at the time the policy is issued. In addition, the Company shall be acceptable to Owner. All liability insurance policies shall name Owner additional insured, IT BEING THE INTENT THAT SUCH POLICIES AFFORD CONTRACTOR AND OWNER
	COVERAGE AGAINST THEIR NEGLIGENCE ARISING OUT OF PERFORMANCE OF THE WORK, and shall provide that coverage of Owner thereunder is primary in the event of overlapping coverage which may be carried by Owner.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Contractor shall not cause any insurance to be canceled nor permit any insurance to lapse. All insurance policies shall include a clause to
	the effect that the policy shall not be canceled or reduced, restricted or limited until thirty (30) days after Owner has received written notice. Certificates of insurance shall contain transcripts from the proper office of the insurer, evidencing
	in particular those insured, the extent of insurance, the location and operations in which the insurance applies, the expiration date and the above mentioned notice of cancellation clause. An acceptable Certificate of Insurance Form shall be
	insurance industry standard ACORD Form 27.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All insurance policies supplied by Contractor shall include a waiver of any right of
	subrogation of the insurers thereunder against Owner and of any right of the insurers to any set-off or counterclaim or any other deduction, whether by attachment of otherwise, in respect of any liability of any person or entity insured under any
	such policy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 9 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage81"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	12.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	FORCE MAJEURE
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. The term &#147;
<U>
	Force Majeure
</U>
	&#148; as used herein shall mean acts of
	God, natural calamities, acts of the public enemy, blockades, insurrections, strikes, slowdowns, riots, wars, disorders, civil disturbances, fires, explosions, storms, floods, landslides, washouts, labor or material shortages, boycotts, breakdowns
	or damage to plants, equipment or facilities, interruptions to transport, embargoes, acts of military authorities, acts of local or federal governmental agencies or regulatory bodies, court actions, arrests and constraints and, without limitation by
	enumeration, any other cause or causes not reasonably within the control and without the fault or negligence of the party affected which wholly or partly prevents the mining, processing, loading or transportation of Product by Contractor or the
	receiving, transporting, accepting or using of the Product by Owner.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. If because of Force Majeure, either party hereto is unable to
	carry out its obligations under this Agreement and if such party shall promptly give to the other written notice of such Force Majeure, including a complete description thereof, then the obligation of the party giving such notice shall be suspended
	to the extent made necessary by Force Majeure and during its continuance; provided, however, that the party giving such notice shall use its best efforts to eliminate such Force Majeure insofar as possible with a minimum of delay. No event of Force
	Majeure shall relieve Owner of its obligation to make payments due for Product delivered by Contractor under this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	13.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	EVENTS OF DEFAULT
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the absence of the existence of force majeure as defined in
<U>
	Section
	12
</U>
	above, if any of the following events (&#147;
<U>
	Events of Default
</U>
	&#148;) shall occur and be continuing:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. Any amount due
	hereunder, unless being disputed in good faith, shall remain unpaid for thirty (30) days after becoming due, and the party adversely affected shall have delivered a notice to the party owing such amount stating the amount due and unpaid, and the
	party owing (and not disputing same in good faith) shall not have paid such amount within thirty (30) days after the delivery of such notice;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. Contractor shall fail or refuse to provide to Owner the amount of Product as specified from time to time hereunder by Owner at the time
	requested by Owner;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C. Contractor shall fail or refuse to provide to Owner the pricing specified under
<U>
	Section 4.D
</U>
	or
<U>
	Section
	4.E
</U>
	of this Agreement;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	D. Any deliveries of kaolin materials to Owner hereunder shall fail to meet the quality specifications
	provided in
<U>
	Exhibit A
</U>
	;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	E. Any other covenant, obligation or agreement by either party hereunder shall not be performed or observed
	within twenty (20) days after written notice of the nonperformance thereof shall have been delivered to the nonperforming party by the other party; or
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	F. Either party shall:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Fail to pay any judgment in an amount which would materially affect the net worth of such party within sixty (60) days after issuance of a writ of execution upon such final judgment;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 10 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage82"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Apply for or consent to the appointment of a receiver, trustee or liquidator of such party or of all or a substantial part of its assets;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Make a general assignment for the benefit of its creditors;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Be adjudicated bankrupt or insolvent, or file a voluntary petition in bankruptcy;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(v)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	File a petition or an answer seeking reorganization under any insolvency law;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(vi)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	File an answer admitting the material allegations of, or consent to, or default in answering, a petition filed against it in any bankruptcy, reorganization or insolvency proceeding;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(vii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	An order, judgment or decree shall be entered by any court of competent jurisdiction approving a petition seeking reorganization of such party or appointing a receiver, trustee or liquidator of a party or of all or a
	substantial part of its assets and such order, judgment or decree shall continue unstayed and in effect for a period of thirty (30) consecutive days;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(viii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Any of the representations or warranties made by a party herein shall be or become untrue in any material respect; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ix)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Contractor shall be in default under any lease of any portion of the Contractor&#146;s Lands after expiration of any cure periods permitted by the lease;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	then the party adversely affected by such Event of Default shall, in addition to other remedies available to such party at law or in equity, have any one (1)
	or more of the following remedies:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The party adversely affected by such Event of Default may by written notice delivered to the other party decline to perform under this Agreement until such Event of Default shall have been cured or shall no longer
	exist, without relieving the defaulting party of any of its obligations hereunder;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The party adversely affected by such Event of Default may, effective upon twenty (20) days&#146; written notice to such effect delivered to the other party, terminate this Agreement without relieving the other party
	from any liability which shall have accrued or attached on or prior to the effective date of such termination; and/or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	If Contractor is in default for failure to deliver Product at the time requested or for delivering kaolin materials failing to meet quality
	specifications, Owner may recover all damages caused by such failure or Owner may purchase such quantities of Product from another source and Contractor shall reimburse Owner within twenty (20) days from invoice for any additional cost incurred by
	Owner
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 11 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage83"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	above the Price Per Ton determined as provided herein for the Product which Contractor failed to deliver and for any costs incidental to obtaining such other supply.&nbsp;Termination of this
	Contract for any of the causes herein contained shall be without prejudice to any other right or remedy provided by this Contract or at law or in equity.&nbsp;Failure of either Owner or Contractor immediately to exercise its rights in any Event of
	Default will not constitute waiver of the injured party&#146;s rights. Both parties agree to use their best efforts to minimize the amount of damages that may be incurred as the result of an Event of Default.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	14.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	NOTICE
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. All notices under this Contract required or permitted to be given by Owner to
	Contractor and all payments to be made by Owner to Contractor hereunder shall be delivered personally to Contractor or sent to Contractor at Contractor&#146;s address:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	Milledgeville,
	Georgia 31061
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	or at such other address as Contractor may hereafter furnish by notice to Owner.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. All notices herein required or permitted to be given by Contractor to Owner shall be sent by registered or certified United States mail,
	return receipt requested, addressed to Owner at:

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	Houston, Texas 77079
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	or at such other address
	as Owner may hereafter furnish by notice to Contractor.

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	15.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	ENTIRE AGREEMENT
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This written instrument contains the entire agreement between the parties
	hereto concerning the subject matter hereof, and there are no other understandings or agreements between said parties or either of them in respect hereto. No change, addition to or waiver of the terms and provision hereof shall be binding upon
	either party unless approved in writing by an authorized representative of such party, and no modifications shall be effected by the acknowledgment or acceptance of forms containing other or different terms and conditions. This Agreement may be
	executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute a single instrument.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	16.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	RESTRICTIVE COVENANT
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. In consideration of Owner&#146;s agreement to purchase from Contractor
	a substantial portion of its actual annual requirements of Product for its operations at the Plant and without intending to limit the legal rights of either party, Contractor agrees that Contractor will not directly or indirectly enter into
	competition with Owner in the manufacture or sale of ceramic
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 12 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage84"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	proppants anywhere in the world; provided that, notwithstanding the foregoing, Contractor shall have the right, subject to the performance of its obligations under
<U>
	Section 17
</U>
	below, to
	sell raw materials to other parties that may be in competition with Owner now or in the future and that may manufacture and/or sell ceramic proppants.&nbsp;This covenant shall apply during the Term of this Agreement and survive for three (3) years
	after the expiration or termination of the Term.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. Contractor and Owner agree and acknowledge as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Substantial consideration is being provided under this Agreement by each of Owner and Contractor for the performance of each party&#146;s obligations under this Agreement, including the obligations contained in
<U>
	Section 16.A above
</U>
	.&nbsp;The parties agree and acknowledge that substantial and valuable consideration has been provided for the covenant contained in such
<U>
	Section&nbsp;16.A
</U>
	, and that the consideration being provided under this
	Agreement is sufficient to support this covenant.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Owner has a protectable interest in its Confidential Information (as defined in
<U>
	Section 17
</U>
	below), and in the substantial Confidential Information that the parties expect to develop from the testing and
	qualification of Product suitable for the production of high-quality, commercial-grade ceramic proppants.&nbsp;Owner derives a competitive advantage from its Confidential Information related to its proprietary manufacturing processes, and takes
	precautions to maintain the confidentiality of these processes and this Confidential Information.&nbsp;Owner would not have entered into this Agreement without the protections afforded to its Confidential Information provided by this
<U>
	Section
	16
</U>
	and by
<U>
	Section 17
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The worldwide territorial scope of
<U>
	Section 16
</U>
	is reasonable in light of the nature of the ceramic proppants business.&nbsp;Owner exports ceramic proppants for oil production around the world, and worldwide
	territorial scope is necessary to protect Owner&#146;s Confidential Information.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The temporal scope of the covenants in
<U>
	Section 16
</U>
	is reasonable, and is intended to approximate the time that a new entrant would need to start up a ceramic proppant manufacturing operation without the benefit of
	Owner&#146;s Confidential Information.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(v)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The covenants in
<U>
	Section 16
</U>
	are reasonably designed to protect the parties&#146; legitimate business interests.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(vi)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Owner and Contractor negotiated the terms of
<U>
	Section 16
</U>
	and the Agreement at arm&#146;s length and with equal bargaining power.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C. If this
<U>
	Section 16
</U>
	is held to be invalid, illegal or unenforceable, in whole or in part, Owner and Contractor agree that it shall be
	&#147;blue-penciled&#148; and interpreted and enforced to be so broad as is enforceable in order to achieve the intent of the parties to the greatest extent possible.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 13 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage85"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	17.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. As used in this Agreement, &#147;
<U>
	Confidential
	Information
</U>
	&#148; shall mean any and all know-how, testing data and results and reports (including without limitation, information generated or exchanged in connection with
<U>
	Section 2
</U>
	of this Agreement, any and all information relating to
	the specific mining tracts or portions thereof and Product with the specifications listed on
<U>
	Appendix A
</U>
	that are suitable for manufacturing a ceramic proppant that meets Owner&#146;s internal quality specifications), business or trade
	secrets, processes, policies, procedures, techniques, strategies, plans, procedures and facilities employed by Owner; Owner&#146;s budgets and strategic plans; client or customer or supplier lists, and information concerning Owner&#146;s customers
	or suppliers; all technology relating to Owner&#146;s businesses, systems and methods of operation; and designs, drawings, know-how, show-how, technical information, specifications, databases, data, methods and manuals and forms pertaining to the
	activities or operations of Owner. Confidential Information shall not include any information which, as established by relevant documentary evidence: (i) is already in Contractor&#146;s lawful possession at the time of disclosure; or (ii) is or
	later becomes, through no act on the part of Contractor, available to the public; or (iii) corresponds in substance to that furnished to Contractor by any third party having no obligation of confidentiality, direct or indirect, to Owner; or (iv)
	corresponds to that furnished by Owner to any third party on a non-confidential basis. Information need not be marked or specifically designated &#147;confidential&#148; to qualify as Confidential Information.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. Contractor shall not use any Confidential Information for any purpose other than as expressly instructed by Owner in connection with this
	Agreement. Contractor shall not disclose Confidential Information to any person (i) without the prior written consent of Owner
<U>
	and
</U>
	(ii) for any purpose other than as expressly instructed by Owner in connection with this Agreement.&nbsp;As a
	condition to any communication or disclosure by Contractor that is authorized by the immediately preceding sentence, Contractor shall inform each person receiving such information of the terms of the confidentiality provisions of this
<U>
	Section
	17
</U>
	and shall require such person&#146;s compliance with such terms. Contractor shall at all times preserve the confidentiality of the Confidential Information for the period described in clause F. below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C. In the event that Contractor becomes legally compelled to communicate or disclose Confidential Information, Contractor shall provide Owner
	with prompt notice of such requirement prior to making any such communication or disclosure. After consultation with and subject to the instructions of Owner, Contractor shall furnish only that portion of the Confidential Information that it is
	legally required to disclose; shall interpose a confidentiality defense based upon this Agreement and any other applicable legal right or privilege in an effort to ensure that such Confidential Information will be accorded confidential treatment;
	and shall offer Owner a reasonable opportunity to intervene in the action, and shall reasonably cooperate with Owner in any attempt by Owner to obtain a protective order or other appropriate confidentiality protection for such Confidential
	Protection prior to making any such communication or disclosure.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	D. Except as otherwise provided in this
<U>
	Section 17
</U>
	, (i) all
	Confidential Information shall be held by Contractor in the strictest confidence, and (ii)&nbsp;Contractor shall use its best efforts at all times to safeguard any Confidential Information from falling into the hands of any unauthorized
	person.&nbsp;Contractor shall not permit any Confidential Information that has been reduced to writing to be duplicated or extracted in any manner, except with the express written consent of Owner or except as otherwise permitted or authorized in
	this
<U>
	Section 17
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 14 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage86"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	E. Contractor shall promptly provide Owner with notice of any actual or threatened breach of any
	of the terms of this
<U>
	Section 17
</U>
	or unauthorized communication, disclosure or use by Contractor of any of the Confidential Information of which it has actual knowledge.&nbsp;Contractor agrees that a breach of the provisions of
<U>
	Section
	16
</U>
	or
<U>
	Section 17
</U>
	of this Agreement will give rise to irreparable injury to Owner for which damages may not be adequate compensation and that, consequently, Owner shall be entitled, in addition to all other remedies available at law or in
	equity, to injunctive and other equitable relief to prevent or remedy a breach of
<U>
	Section 16
</U>
	and/or
<U>
	Section 17
</U>
	of this Agreement and to secure the enforcement of those sections.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	F. Contractor&#146;s obligations with respect to the Confidential Information shall survive for three (3) years after the expiration or
	termination of the Term.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	G. Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, or at any time at the request of Owner, Contractor
	shall promptly return to Owner or destroy all Confidential Information in Contractor&#146;s possession or under its control, including Confidential Information reflected in any analyses, studies, notes, compilations or other documents prepared by
	Contractor, and Contractor shall not retain any copies or other reproductions or extracts thereof. At any time at the request of Owner, Contractor shall destroy or have destroyed all memoranda, notes, reports and documents, including any analyses,
	studies, notes, compilations or other documents containing Confidential Information prepared by Contractor, whether in &#147;hard copy&#148; form or as stored on magnetic or other media, and all copies and other reproductions and extracts thereof,
	prepared by Contractor. At the request of Owner, Contractor shall certify to Owner that such destruction has taken place.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	18.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	SURVIVAL
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	Sections 10
</U>
	,
<U>
	11
</U>
	,
<U>
	16
</U>
	,
<U>
	17
</U>
	and
<U>
	21
</U>
	shall survive
	expiration of this Agreement.
</P>

	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	19.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	ASSIGNMENT
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Agreement shall be binding on the legal successors of the parties hereto, but
	shall not otherwise be assignable by either party without the written consent of the other, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, delayed or denied.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	20.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Contractor shall be considered an independent contractor and shall not
	be considered a partner, employee, agent or servant of Owner.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	21.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	APPLICABLE LAW
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Agreement and the language used herein shall be construed and enforced in
	accordance with the laws of the State of Georgia, without giving effect to such state&#146;s conflicts of law provisions or principles that would make the laws of any other jurisdiction applicable to this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 15 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage87"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	22.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	MEMORANDUM OF THIS AGREEMENT
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Contractor and Owner agree to execute and record in the real
	property records of the county where the Contractor&#146;s Lands are located a memorandum of this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	23.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	NATURAL GAS USAGE
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Contractor acknowledges that Owner desires for Contractor to investigate
	opportunities for the use of compressed natural gas (&#147;
<U>
	CNG
</U>
	&#148;) to fuel Contractor&#146;s fleet of trucks and equipment used in the performance of this Agreement (&#147;
<U>
	Fleet
</U>
	&#148;). Contractor agrees to use reasonable commercial
	efforts to use CNG in its fleet, and will periodically report to Owner with respect to its plans to convert the Fleet to CNG in a manner that balances potential fuel savings with the burden of initial capital costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Agreement to be executed as of the day and year first above written.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
